title: How is tech already causing shenanigans at the Paris Olympics?
text: How is tech already causing shenanigans at the Paris Olympics? Answer: With errant drones and delayed referee calls. The 2024 Paris Summer Olympics don’t officially kick off until Friday afternoon EST, but some events have already gotten underway. And so have some technology-related shenanigans. On Wednesday, a staff member of the Canadian women’s soccer team was caught flying a drone over the practice session of the New Zealand women’s team. A late goal by Argentina had the game supposedly ending in a 2-2 draw, and the players and fans left the stadium. However, 90 minutes later the teams had to re-enter the stadium and finish the match because the video assistant referee tech had determined that the play that resulted in Argentina’s final goal had been offside.
